model_answer:
The correct answer is B: Event 3 — Running the installer, selecting English, and letting the setup extract files to complete installation.

This action installs the Tor Browser on the computer, which is necessary for using the dark web. Once installed, the browser can be launched and configured to use the Tor network, as shown in Event 5. The green onion logo and external IP address will only be visible after the browser has been configured to use Tor.

The most plausible steps leading to reaching the directory of links were:

A: Event 6 — Using DuckDuckGo inside Tor to search for “best onion sites,” described as a search engine that doesn’t track you.
B: Event 7 — Opening an ExpressVPN blog post listing .onion URLs and explaining they only work in Tor.
C: Event 9 — Returning to The Hidden Wiki and clicking its Main Page link while the browser shows “Connecting…,” with a caution about its links.

These events involve searching for information related to accessing The Dark Web, visiting websites that discuss usingTor, and navigating to The Hidden Wiki's main page. These actions are likely to lead users to discover categories like “Commercial Services” and “Anonymity & Security” on The Hidden Wiki.
